intro: Urnectis hirta, commonly known as the hairy urn-plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant features finely hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
